body_html:
It looks like the error is caused by the use of __shfl_down(), support for which was added in Compute Capability 3.x devices. Since we don't officially support these older devices, I doubt that we will add a workaround for your GPU, although it may be possible to get TensorFlow to build by disabling kernels that use this feature.

@benoitsteiner Do you happen to know which Eigen-based kernels make use of Compute Capability 3.x features? Or are there any #defines that could make the build work for @jithurjacob's older CC 2.1 GPU?
body_text:
It looks like the error is caused by the use of __shfl_down(), support for which was added in Compute Capability 3.x devices. Since we don't officially support these older devices, I doubt that we will add a workaround for your GPU, although it may be possible to get TensorFlow to build by disabling kernels that use this feature.
@benoitsteiner Do you happen to know which Eigen-based kernels make use of Compute Capability 3.x features? Or are there any #defines that could make the build work for @jithurjacob's older CC 2.1 GPU?
body:
It looks like the error is caused by the use of `__shfl_down()`, support for which was [added in Compute Capability 3.x devices](https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/cuda-c-programming-guide/#warp-shuffle-functions). Since we don't officially support these older devices, I doubt that we will add a workaround for your GPU, although it may be possible to get TensorFlow to build by disabling kernels that use this feature.

@benoitsteiner Do you happen to know which Eigen-based kernels make use of Compute Capability 3.x features? Or are there any `#define`s that could make the build work for @jithurjacob's older CC 2.1 GPU?
